FuncDef: The reset mpls rsvp-te p2mp sub-lsp command is used to restart Sub-LSP of a specified P2MP TE tunnel.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the tunnel ID.
The value is an integer in the range of 0 to 65535.

Specifies the tunnel LSP ID.
The value is an integer in the range of 0 to 65535.

Specifies the Ingress LSR ID.
The value is an integer in the range of 0 to 4294967295.

Specifies the Sub-group ID.
The value is an integer in the range of 0 to 65535.

Specifies the Sub-group originator ID.
The value is an integer in the range of 0 to 4294967295.

Specifies the S2L-Destination.
The value is an integer in the range of 0 to 4294967295.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If errors occur in services transmitted on an automatic P2MP TE tunnel and the services cannot be restored, run the reset mpls rsvp-te p2mp sub-lsp command to reestablish the Sub-LSP of P2MP TE tunnel to restore the services.
Configuration Impact
After this command is run, the specified Sub-LSP is torn down and reestablished.
